alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gilmer; Harrison; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:39PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, central Gilmer, Lewis, Braxton, northwestern Upshur, southeastern Roane, northeastern Clay, west central Barbour and southeastern Harrison Counties through 515 PM EST... At 439 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gassaway, or 8 miles northwest of Sutton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weston, Glenville, Sutton, Gassaway, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, Big Otter, Cedar Creek State Park, Wallback, Burnsville, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flatwoods, Sand Fork, Nebo, Shock, Rosedale, Little Birch, Alum Bridge and Ireland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 33 and 111. Route 19 between mile markers 64 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
